intro: Aganosma calycina, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while producing its own carbohydrates through photosynthesis. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Aganosma calycina is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
